Flesh Crawlers are medium level monsters found in the second level of the Stronghold of Security. They drop the bottom of sceptre, one of four parts of the Skull sceptre. Flesh crawlers drop herbs often, and are frequently killed for their uncommon Ranarr drops.

Contents

  • 1 Locations
  • 2 Strategies
  • 3 Drops
    • 3.1 Runes
    • 3.2 Herbs
    • 3.3 Coins
    • 3.4 Other
    • 3.5 Gem drop table
  • 4 References

Locations[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Spawns Map
Stronghold of Security: Catacomb of Famine416Maplink

Stronghold of Security: Catacomb of Famine417Maplink
Stronghold of Security: Catacomb of Famine285Maplink

Strategies[edit | edit source]

Flesh crawlers are aggressive to any level players. Range is a good strategy as there are safespots in the rooms. It is possible to hide behind nonaggressive giant rats in one room and range the flesh crawlers, protected from their rapid, although weak, attacks. Their attack speed is three ticks, or equivalent to the Event rpg. Because these attacks max at 1 damage, the use of a Regen bracelet can help to offset much of the damage taken, especially if the player has a strong defence.

For minimal user-input (also known as afk or semi-afk training), turn on auto retaliate and let the Flesh Crawlers come to you. When they lose their aggressiveness, simply move to another room, then come back.

To reduce banking trips needed, deposit all non-stackable drops when you are teleported to random events, and drop all herbs aside from Ranarr, as Ranarrs are often more valuable than even their highest levelled herbs such as dwarf weed.

Drops[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 291,597 kills from the Drop Rate Project, unless otherwise cited.

The average Flesh Crawler kill is worth 282.4.
